Kamal Ahmed wrote:

> Any idea, Anyone on how to go about testing this? Because, When I am trying
> to use the TimePeriod constructor, I get an error: 
> 
> "Change the visibility of TimePeriod.java to public.

That means you aren't supposed to use the constructor. Presumably 
there's some means somewhere of creating TimePeriod objects. Use that 
instead. If there's no such mechanism, the TimePeriod class is pointless 
and can be deleted or ignored.
